channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large pot hole on pavement, 8th December
item.description:
On the pavement outside number 50. Caused by a skip lorry not adequately protecting the pavement. Has been there for c.8 weeks. Potential trip hazard for elderly neighbours/small children

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chosen Drive, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: 12 inch pothole along the line where the slip road leaves the main road, 8th December
item.description:
Where the slip road into Bishops Cleeve leaves the main Evesham to Cheltenham Road. Has worsened considerably due to all south-bound traffic being diverted into the slip-road, during the recent closure of the main road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned road closure sign, 8th December
item.description:
According to the signage the Poole Rd is shut outside the Royal Mail sorting office. This sign was left when the road was shut due to the incident underneath the railway bridge last week. Why are contractors allowed to leave signs out? Where's the responsibility?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Poole Way, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: The sun has "vandalised" the sign by fading its wording., 8th December
item.description:
The rectangular sign should read something like " humps so wide". It's under a triangular sign with red edging and white interior with a black hump sign. It's outside 1, Insley Gardens on the left as soon as you travel up it from Hucclecote Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Insley Gardens, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign has been vandalised (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Blocked drain, 8th December
item.description:
Drain blocked under railway bridge on Statuon Road causing water to build up when it rains and causing the road to flood when there is a lot of rain. swing.cheeks.blank
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Tewkesbury
